com.artisan.incodeapi

Class Experiment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.artisan.incodeapi.Experiment

  • public class Experiment
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents an in-code experiment, including its name and variants.

    Instead of creating Experiment objects directly, it's better to use the methods defined in ArtisanExperimentManager.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Experiment(java.lang.String experimentName)
      Rather than instantiate an experiment yourself, use ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperiment(String)
      or ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperimentWithDescription(String, String)
      Experiment(java.lang.String experimentName, java.lang.String description)
      Rather than instantiate an experiment yourself, use ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperiment(String)
      or ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperimentWithDescription(String, String)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add a variant to the experiment.

      Get a List of all of the variants registered for this experiment
      boolean isCurrentVariant(java.lang.String variantName)
      It is better to use ArtisanExperimentManager.isCurrentVariantForExperiment(String, String)
      boolean isRunning()
      Is this experiment currently started.
      void setPublishedValue(java.lang.String publishedValue) 
      void startExperiment(java.lang.String variantName)
      Starts the experiment with a given variant.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Experiment

        public Experiment(java.lang.String experimentName)

        Rather than instantiate an experiment yourself, use ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperiment(String)
        or ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperimentWithDescription(String, String)

        Parameters:
        experimentName - the name of the experiment

      • Experiment

        public Experiment(java.lang.String experimentName,
          java.lang.String description)

        Rather than instantiate an experiment yourself, use ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperiment(String)
        or ArtisanExperimentManager.registerExperimentWithDescription(String, String)

        Parameters:
        experimentName - the name of the experiment
        description - the description of the experiment

    • Method Detail

      • getPublishedValue

        public java.lang.String getPublishedValue()

      • setPublishedValue

        public void setPublishedValue(java.lang.String publishedValue)

      • addVariant

        public void addVariant(java.lang.String variantName,
              boolean isDefault)

        Add a variant to the experiment. It's better to use ArtisanExperimentManager.addVariantForExperiment(String, String).

        Warning: Attempting to add two variants with the same name will result in the second being ignored.

        Parameters:
        variantName - The name of the variant you're adding
        isDefault - Whether this is the default variant for this experiment. Note that if this is the first variant for the experiment, it is assumed to be the default, regardless of the value of isDefault, until another variant is added with isDefault set to true.

      • isCurrentVariant

        public boolean isCurrentVariant(java.lang.String variantName)
        It is better to use ArtisanExperimentManager.isCurrentVariantForExperiment(String, String)
        Parameters:
        variantName - the name of the variant that you would like to check to see if it is current.
        Returns:
        true if the currently running variant is equal to variantName, otherwise, false is returned.

      • startExperiment

        public void startExperiment(java.lang.String variantName)

        Starts the experiment with a given variant.

        It is better to use ArtisanExperimentManager.startExperiment(String, String)

        Warning: This method is intended for local test and QA use only, and should not be used within production code.

        Parameters:
        variantName - the name of the variant that you'd like to use in the experiment.

      • stopExperiment

        public void stopExperiment()

        Stops the experiment.

        Warning: This stops the experiment completely, reverting it back to the default variant.

      • getDefaultVariant

        public java.lang.String getDefaultVariant()

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Is this experiment currently started.
        Returns:
        true if this experiment is running

      • getVariants
